translated: Birth-Stories🔽The Group of Three🔽The Chapter on the Well
The Birth Story of the Chataka Bird
“You are a crane, you are a peacock,
you are a thief, you are a monkey;
my friend the crow is fierce.”
“I am not a crane, I am not a peacock,
look, I have come, cut up.”
“You will be guilty again, my friend,
for your virtue is like this;
are not well enjoyed by birds.”
The Chataka Bird Birth Story is the fourth.
